intro: Pleiarina jaliscana, commonly known as the Jalisco pleioblastus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its drought-resistant properties. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
